lines.text: [Jack needs a helicopter]
I'm here to rent the Huey.
We don't rent it anymore, but it is for sale.
How much?
Two million dollars.
Uh, my pilot and I will have to take it for a test drive.
Of course, you just have to leave a deposit.
How much is that?
Two million dollars.
Umm...
[Shows a CIA business card]
Would you take a company check?
[Before commencing a covert action]
this is your deal, not mine, so unless I have written authorization, this whole thing is over before it starts because I'm not going to be the only one left without a chair when the music stops.
These drug cartels represent a clear and present danger to the national security of the United States.
[On whether Jack should investigate the growing scandal]
you gave your word to the people of the United States. Your word is who you are.
The machine is still on, Moira.
[Cortez realizes his betrayal has been exposed]

[referring to Jack Ryan]
Whatever this man has told you is a lie. He LIES for a living!
He is in the Intelligence business.
Exactly.
YOU'RE in the Intelligence business!
[Escobedo plays back Cortez's conversation with Cutter]
I didn't sign up for this. This is someone's bullshit political agenda. Who authorized this? Cutter?
Cutter couldn't tie his own shoes without permission.
If I go down you're coming with me.

Wrong again. I have an *autographed get-out-of-jail-free card*! "The President of the United States authorizes Deputy Director of the CIA Robert Ritter to conduct 'Operation Reciprocity' including all necessary funding and support. This action is deemed important to the national security of the United States etcetera, etcetera, etcetera." You don't *have* one of these, do you Jack?
[as Ryan walks away]
Gray! The world is gray, Jack!

[on who gets punished for 'Reciprocity']
You'll take the blame. Cutter and Ritter will take some too, but it won't amount to much. They'll get a slap on the wrist and $20,000 an hour on the lecture circuit. The rest, you'll dump on Greer. Yes, you'll take him down with you. You'll *destroy* his reputation. But it won't go any further than that. It's the ol' Potomac two-step, Jack.
I'm sorry, Mr. President, I don't dance.
How dare you come in here and lecture me!
How dare *you*, sir!
How dare you come into this office and bark at me like some little junkyard dog? I am the President of the United States!
What would you say if I promised you that I would reduce the cocaine shipments to your country by half?
I'd say you were using too much of your own product.
[Entering the White House grounds]
Uh, where do I park?
Who authorized this?
I'm sure they'll ask you that.
Who authorized it?
I have no recollection, Senator
Said anything yet?
Yeah. "We're innocent."
Till the D.A. offers them a deal.
He already has. Regular or extra crispy. He was either referring to fried chicken or the electric chair.
You're going to jail, pal!

[seeing Ryan holding a piece of paper]
What is that? What is it you *think* you have there?
You broke the law.
You are *such* a Boy Scout! You see everything in black and white!
No, no, no! Not black and white Ritter, *right* and *wrong*!
Jack, computer theft is a serious crime.
[hangs up the phone]

[to himself]
So are crimes against the Constitution.
Hey, get out of my chopper!
No, no - *my* chopper.
[Hands Clark receipt]

[confronting Ritter on "Reciprocity"]
Why was I kept out if it?
You weren't kept out of it, you're NECK DEEP in it! You went before Congress and you got the money for it!

[on Cutter's computer]
They're in. Congratulation, James, you've got your own little war.
Circular error probable zero. Impact with high-order detonation. Have a nice day.

[a attack has occurred on the American delegation, secretly ordered by Escobedo's intelligence man Cortez]
You don't want to hear an answer.
Yes I do.
It was done to look like you did it... by one of the others, as you suspected. It's always a friend who hates you most.
Who is doing this to me?
If I were to guess...
No, that is not I asked of you, to guess. I can guess.

[speaking to Jack Ryan]
You want to know about politics in Washington? Four words. Watch your back, Jack.
Are you suggesting a course of action, sir?
The course of action I'd suggest is a course of action I can't suggest.
[Escobedo hears Cortez's recorded conversation with Cutter]
So. What am I supposed to do with YOU!
[slugs Cortez with a baseball bat]
Perhaps I'm supposed to kill you with this bat!
[Sipo, Cortez's henchman comes in and guns down Escobedo]
[Cortez is blackmailing Cutter]
You've taken care of the *little fish*. I will take care of the one that got away. Once Escobedo is gone, I will be in the position to help you.
[the President is on TV announcing the seizure of the drug money]
They're stealing MY MONEY!
[the President pretends to deny the actual amounts]

[to the TV]
No, you're not. You're stealing my money. I'm making it and you're STEALING IT!

[to Felix]
Someone will DIE for this!
"Reciprocity." That's a clever name for it. Revenge is a very, very, very dangerous motivation.
Are you able to handle this operation or not? What I'm looking for here is a simple yes or no.
What you're looking for is a political mess.
Yes or no?
Is that what they want? Because that's what this is.
They want what every first-term administration wants - a second term.
So go down there, establish it.
Go down where?
Colombia.
Who, me?
The chicken is in the pot, over.
Cook it!
[Chavez was able to close in on the Sergeant Major by using a cheeseburger wrapper as a decoy]
Soldier, how did you get so close to me?
Sniper approached the instructor by being a sneaky bastard, Sergeant Major!
[repeated line]
This is our money.
